text: Bob Lynn (February 23, 1933 â€“ May 25, 2020) was an American politician. He was a Republican member of the Alaska House of Representatives, representing the 31st district from 2003 to 2013 and the 26th district from 2013 to 2017. He was born in Los Angeles. He was Chair of the State Affairs Committee, was Vice-Chair of the Judiciary Committee, and was a member of the Transportation Committee and Joint Armed Forces Committees. He also was on the Labor & Workforce Development, Military & Veterans' Affairs, and Public Safety Finance Subcommittees, for the 28th Legislature. Lynn died on May 25, 2020 in California from a long-illness, aged 87. ==References== ==Other websites== * Bob Lynn at 100 Years of Alaska's Legislature Category:1933 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in California Category:State legislators of the United States Category:Politicians from Los Angeles Category:Politicians from Anchorage, Alaska Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Bob Lynn
